title: Understanding Schedule IV Substances
text: Schedule IV substances are considered to have a lower potential for abuse compared to Schedule III substances. They are often used in medical treatments and have a lower risk of dependence.

title: Characteristics of Schedule IV Substances
text: These substances are known for their medical use and have a lower potential for abuse and dependence compared to substances in Schedules I, II, and III.

hintAnswer: low potential for abuse and low risk of dependence
title: Identifying the Correct Definition
text: Which of the following best describes Schedule IV substances?
choices: moderate to low potential for physical and psychological dependence
low potential for abuse and low risk of dependence
lower potential for abuse than Schedule IV and consists of preparations containing limited quantities of certain narcotics
